channel.title: Posts on Abijango
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Abijango

item.title: Tesla Model 3 Performance, 6 month ownership review
item.description: This started of as an initial first impressions piece, and as I did not publish it over the weeks leading to months, it turned into a full blown review, though a very casual one, no feeds and speeds comparisons found here. If you are interested in that, I am sure there are many, many posts online comparing this car to every possible car out there. This is just my experience and impressions of how and where my obsession with Tesla started, a short history down memory lane, and how I found the process of buying and owning this in a daily capacity.

item.title: How Iceland reduced teenage substance abuse
item.description: It all started with psychologist asking the right questions: ‚ÄúAny college kid could say: why do they start? Well, there‚Äôs availability, they‚Äôre risk-takers, alienation, maybe some depression,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúBut why do they continue? So I got to the question about the threshold for abuse and the lights went on ‚Äì that‚Äôs when I had my version of the ‚Äòaha‚Äô experience: they could be on the threshold for abuse before they even took the drug, because it was their style of coping that they were abusing.

item.title: Worship at the altar of Acros
item.description: The Fujifilm Neopan Acros or simple Acros as it is referred to, is sadly one of the discontinued film stocks that Fujifilm produced for many years. Though there is some rumours that it might come back, ü§ûüèΩ. The Fujifilm X-series cameras from the X-Pro2 onwards, X-T2, X100F and all the newer ones have the Acros film simulation built into the cameras. This is one of the reasons I stuck to Fuji cameras when at first I had picked up the X-T2 somewhat by accident.

item.title: Nintendo Switch overtakes SNES with more than 52 million sold
item.description: John Gruber writing over at Daring Fireball, linking to an article for the Verge: The Switch is a hit because the games are great, but the OS is also a triumph, and contributes to the joyfulness of using it. I‚Äôve only played a few Switch games when a friend generously lent me his Switch to try out Breath of the Wild (An amazing game), but besides the games, the Switch is a delight to use.

item.title: Self Driving DeLorean is taught to Drift
item.description: This is just insane! I want this on my Tesla like yesterday! Please please please Elon make it happen üòÇ Completing the ‚ÄúMARTYkhana‚Äù course on the first attempt was awesome, but he knew that the one-of-a-kind data gleaned from the run could transform the capabilities of autonomous driving systems found in cars today. First try? üòÇ Not really but woah!

item.title: The voice at embankment station
item.description: When people come together for a simple human kindness :).

item.title: One man tries Windows after 20 years
item.description: It went almost exactly how you would expect :) I especially liked this tidbit: Want to run Docker for Windows on your brand new Surface Laptop 3? Sorry, can‚Äôt do that without buying an upgrade to Windows Pro (the $1800 Surface Laptop 3 apparently wasn‚Äôt expensive enough to warrant that designation, so it ships with the Home edition. Okay, sheesh). üòÇüòÇüòÇ

item.title: Street photography with the X100F (Day 0)
item.description: Ever since getting the X100F I have been using it on and off. I have a more detailed post coming at some point with my thoughts on the camera itself. Spoiler alert: It is freaking amazing! But till then, enjoy some of the first few street pictures I have taken with the camera.

item.title: Boris Johnson is shadier than you thought
item.description: Not only has Boris used his infamous ‚Äòdead cat strategy‚Äô to move the conversation away from him and Carrie Symonds and his plans for Brexit, he‚Äôs managed to push down his past mistakes on Google, too ‚Äî making it more difficult for people to get a quick snapshot of relevant information. He‚Äôs not just controlling the narrative here ‚Äî he‚Äôs practically rewriting it. And judged by the standards of an SEO campaign, it‚Äôs hard to describe it as anything other than a resounding success.

item.title: The Tesla advantage
item.description: From industry expert analysis: Even modern EVs from veteran carmakers are finding it hard to match the Roadster‚Äôs 245-mile EPA range. The Audi e-tron, for example, just has 204 miles of range per charge, while the award-winning I-PACE has an EPA rating of 234 miles per charge. Tesla‚Äôs advantage or so, can be narrowed down to a few things: All-electric only design, instead of converting existing platforms for EVs.

item.title: A day in London with family
item.description: A few images from the day roaming the streets of London. Didn‚Äôt get a lot of keepers, but oh well, that‚Äôs how it goes sometimes. ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Makes it feel like home, you know? pic.twitter.com/x1tPjI7bi0 — Tesla (@Tesla) September 18, 2019 So long suckaaaa‚Äôs at Porsche üòÉ Data from our track tests indicates that Model S Plaid can achieve 7:20 at the N√ºrburgring. With some improvements, 7:05 may be possible when Model S returns next month. — Tesla (@Tesla) September 19, 2019

item.title: X-Pro3 the Design Failure before a single test üòÇ
item.description: Olaf Sztaba writing on his blog about the uproar on the internet on the new design that Fujifilm revealed for the highly anticipated X-Pro3. First, nobody or almost nobody who is crying wolf has had a chance to shoot with this camera yet. Luckily, it appears that a physical camera is no longer needed to prove its usefulness to the world. People just know! What a brilliant bunch! Saves a lot of hassle.

item.title: Twitter Gold as usual
item.description: Oh how much would I like to work at SpaceX or Tesla! üò≠ Droid Junkyard, Tatooine pic.twitter.com/yACFR9y04P — Elon Musk (@elonmusk) September 17, 2019

item.title: Daredevil Might Return
item.description: I want Daredevil back! Out of all the Marvel TV series, I think Daredevil was clearly the best, with Punisher a close second. I think they lost the plot with Iron Fist and Luke Cage (really? What was that). Jessica Jones was just OK. There is so much more that can be done with the medium and the stories coming straight of the comics, modified for modern TV audiences, see HBO Watchmen.

item.title: Deepest place on earth
item.description: I love the Kurzgesagt videos! This one was particularly interesting.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 Twitter is a mega troll
item.description: Whoever this person is, I give him 9000 troll points! We have a feeling that this design is going to stick around. #2077 pic.twitter.com/Box6pG6Tee — Cyberpunk 2077 (@CyberpunkGame) September 10, 2019
